org.openmuc.jdlms.client.hdlc.impl
Class HdlcClientLayer

java.lang.Object
  org.openmuc.jdlms.client.hdlc.impl.HdlcClientLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>, IUpperLayer
public class HdlcClientLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUpperLayer, ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>

Class representing a HDLC connection sub layer. This class and its State classes (see HdlcClientLayerState) implement the subset of the HDLC standard stated in IEC 62056-46

connect

public void connect(long timeout)
             throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: ILowerLayer
Connects to the defined remote end point. Note that the destination end point is fixed upon creation, if you want to connect to another end point, you have to create another object implementing this Interface

Specified by:

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: ILowerLayer
Gracefully close the connection to the remote end point. It is up to the lower layer connection implementing this interface if the remote end point shall be sent a disconnection message or not

Specified by:
disconnect in interface ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>
Throws:
java.io.IOException

registerReceivingListener

public void registerReceivingListener(java.lang.Object key,
                                      IUpperLayer listener)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: ILowerLayer
Registers an upper layer connection object to the lower layer connection object. This method should be called before the first call of the connect method to ensure receiving of all incoming data Depending of the connection, several higher layer connections can be mapped to the same lower layer connection (e.g. multiple logical devices connected through the same physical device), so an additional address field has to be provided to differentiate between the upper layer connections

Specified by:
registerReceivingListener in interface ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
key - Key to uniquely identify the listener. May be null depending on the implementing ITransportLayer object (e.g. a connection that only allows one upper layer at a time)
listener - The upper layer connection to be registered
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If address is already in use

removeReceivingListener

public void removeReceivingListener(IUpperLayer listener)
Description copied from interface: ILowerLayer
Unregisters an upper layer connection object. This method should be called after the last call of the disconnect method

Specified by:
removeReceivingListener in interface ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
listener - The upper layer connection to be unregistered

discardMessage

public void discardMessage(byte[] data)
Description copied from interface: ILowerLayer
Discards the message with the given data bytes if the underlying layer buffers messages. This method is called if an upper layer times out and the request is aborted

Specified by:
discardMessage in interface ILowerLayer<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
data - Data of the to discarded message

dataReceived

public void dataReceived(byte[] data)
Description copied from interface: IUpperLayer
Callback method, indicating that data has been received from the remote end point. If the lower layer adds frame header or footer around the sent data, these headers have to be already stripped at this point

Specified by:
dataReceived in interface IUpperLayer
Parameters:
data - The received data as raw byte array.

remoteDisconnect

public void remoteDisconnect()
Description copied from interface: IUpperLayer
Callback method, indicating that the remote end point closed the connection. This method is provided to allow the upper layers to gracefully close the connection and clean up.

Specified by:
remoteDisconnect in interface IUpperLayer
